jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Pawp 🐾

Pawp is reimagining access to pet care. We’re building a digital-first platform that makes caring for your pet simpler, more affordable, and more human. With 24/7 virtual care, smart tools, and financial safety nets, Pawp empowers pet parents to make better decisions—without unnecessary stress.

We’re a passionate, mission-driven team backed by top-tier investors, and we’re looking for an iOS Engineer to help us shape the future of pet care.

About the Role:

As an iOS Engineer at Pawp, you’ll play a critical role in building beautiful, intuitive, and high-performing mobile experiences that delight our users. You’ll work closely with product, design, and engineering teammates to bring new features to life and continuously improve our app. This is a role for someone who sweats the small stuff—who obsesses over UI details, craves clean layouts, and believes great UX starts with great code.

What You’ll Do:

  • Build and maintain features in our iOS app using SwiftUI and The Composable Architecture (TCA)

  • Work closely with design to craft pixel-perfect, simple, and elegant user interfaces

  • Help define and enforce UI/UX best practices across the app

  • Collaborate with backend engineers to integrate APIs and ensure smooth end-to-end experiences

  • Proactively identify performance issues and squash bugs before they reach users

  • Contribute to architectural decisions and advocate for clean, maintainable, and scalable code

  • Participate in code reviews, and help mentor other developers where possible

What We’re Looking For:

  • 3+ years of professional iOS development experience

  • Strong command of SwiftUI and TCA, with a deep understanding of their nuances

  • A keen eye for design and layout; you care about the visual polish as much as the functionality

  • Experience building and shipping consumer-facing apps with high-quality UI/UX

  • Ability to turn design specs into pixel-perfect screens that work across devices

  • Familiarity with performance profiling and debugging tools in Xcode

  • A self-starter mentality with excellent communication and collaboration skills

  • Bonus: experience working in early-stage startups or fast-paced product teams
jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT PAWP 🐾

Pawp is reimagining access to pet care. We’re building a digital-first platform that makes caring for your pet simpler, more affordable, and more human. With 24/7 virtual care, smart tools, and financial safety nets, Pawp empowers pet parents to make better decisions—without unnecessary stress.

We’re a passionate, mission-driven team backed by top-tier investors, and we’re looking for an iOS Engineer to help us shape the future of pet care.


ABOUT THE ROLE:

As an iOS Engineer at Pawp, you’ll play a critical role in building beautiful, intuitive, and high-performing mobile experiences that delight our users. You’ll work closely with product, design, and engineering teammates to bring new features to life and continuously improve our app. This is a role for someone who sweats the small stuff—who obsesses over UI details, craves clean layouts, and believes great UX starts with great code.


WHAT YOU’LL DO:

 - Build and maintain features in our iOS app using SwiftUI and The Composable Architecture (TCA)

 - Work closely with design to craft pixel-perfect, simple, and elegant user interfaces

 - Help define and enforce UI/UX best practices across the app

 - Collaborate with backend engineers to integrate APIs and ensure smooth end-to-end experiences

 - Proactively identify performance issues and squash bugs before they reach users

 - Contribute to architectural decisions and advocate for clean, maintainable, and scalable code

 - Participate in code reviews, and help mentor other developers where possible


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

 - 3+ years of professional iOS development experience

 - Strong command of SwiftUI and TCA, with a deep understanding of their nuances

 - A keen eye for design and layout; you care about the visual polish as much as the functionality

 - Experience building and shipping consumer-facing apps with high-quality UI/UX

 - Ability to turn design specs into pixel-perfect screens that work across devices

 - Familiarity with performance profiling and debugging tools in Xcode

 - A self-starter mentality with excellent communication and collaboration skills

 - Bonus: experience working in early-stage startups or fast-paced product teams

jobs.title: Licensed Veterinarian (Remote - Independent Contractor)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Pawp, we’re building a new standard in veterinary care—one that’s accessible, innovative, and designed for scale. Our mission is to expand access to high-quality veterinary care for tens of millions of pets, combining the expertise of licensed veterinarians with the power of intelligent technology.

We’re looking for passionate, experienced veterinarians to help more pets than ever before—all from the comfort of your home. If you’re ready for more freedom, less friction, and the chance to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!

Skills

  • Deliver Virtual Care: Provide remote video consultations through Pawp’s advanced, yet simple-to-use tools, thoroughly evaluating each patient’s medical data and concerns with care and expertise. Establish a veterinarian-client-patient relationship (VCPR).

  • Create Impactful Care Plans: Use your clinical judgment to develop care plans, prescribe medications when appropriate, and empower pet parents with clear, compassionate guidance. Refer for in-person care when necessary.

  • Champion Education: Share educational insights and resources to help pet parents make informed decisions and become better advocates for their pets’ health.

  • Ensure Quality & Compliance: Obtain informed consent, maintain detailed and compliant medical records, and strictly adhere to all laws, regulations, and best practices in telemedicine.

  • Collaborate & Grow: Work alongside a talented, mission-driven team, with ongoing support and oversight from Pawp’s medical leadership.

Requirements

  • Active Veterinary License in good standing in at least one of these states: AZ, CA, FL, ID, MO, NJ, NY, OH, PA, VT, VA, WA. Multi-state licensure is a plus!

  • Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) degree and at least 3 years of post-graduate clinical experience preferred.

  • Valid liability Insurance for all services provided.

  • Excellent Communication: Able to explain medical terms in simple, empathetic language—both verbally and in writing.

  • Commitment to Quality: Detail-oriented, ethical, and always putting patient welfare first.

  • Availability: 2–10 hours per week from your desktop computer. Hours vary depending on state licensure.

If you’re excited to help shape the future of pet health, enjoy flexible remote work, and thrive in a supportive, tech-forward environment, Pawp is for you. Apply today and be part of a team that’s caring for more pets each day than any single clinic in the country!

Notice: This is not an employment opportunity; it is an independent contractor opportunity under a vendor services agreement.
